intro: Godetia quadrivulnera var. rubrissima, commonly known as the scarlet godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in terminal racemes and bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
